meanings.definition: The terminal part of the human arm located below the forearm, used for grasping and holding.
meanings.sent1: She gently placed the book in her hands.
meanings.sent2: He washed his hands before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to catch the moving hands of the clock.
meanings.sent4: Her hands were like delicate petals, holding the fragile glass ornament.
meanings.sent5: The hands of the clock seemed to mock him as time slipped away.

meanings.definition: A pointer on a clock or watch indicating the time.
meanings.sent1: The hands of the clock showed it was time for bed.
meanings.sent2: The watch's hands moved slowly as he waited for the meeting to end.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to stop the hands of the clock from moving.
meanings.sent4: Time's hands pointed towards the future, urging him to keep moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The hands of the clock danced around, marking each passing second.

meanings.definition: A round of applause or approval.
meanings.sent1: The audience erupted in thunderous applause, clapping their hands.
meanings.sent2: She smiled at the warm hands of approval from her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The hands of the crowd clapped in unison, creating a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent4: His heart swelled with joy at the hands of appreciation he received.
meanings.sent5: The hands of the audience came together in a symphony of praise.

meanings.sent1: The hands in the factory worked tirelessly to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: He was known as one of the most skilled hands in the carpentry business.
meanings.sent3: The hands in the field toiled under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent4: She admired the rough hands of the mechanic, a testament to his hard work.
meanings.sent5: The hands of the laborer were calloused but capable, shaping the world around them.
